articles.author: Yannick, Customer Care Team Leader - Pro Team
articles.description:
Improvement
¬†¬†
We‚Äôre happy to announce that we just upgraded our Invoicing app with several improvements. 
Here are the highlights of what you can expect from the latest update:
Better User Experience
We‚Äôve improved the app to make it more intuitive and user-friendly, with a smoother navigation flow.
Enhanced Stability
Our developers have put in significant effort to ensure the app‚Äôs stability and avoid unexpected crashes or performance hiccups.
Improved Search Function
Finding invoices and relevant information is now quicker and more precise.
Cleaner Interface
We understand the importance of a clutter-free interface. The app now flaunts a cleaner and more modern look that ensures a visually appealing invoicing experience.
As always, our customer support team is here to assist you should you have any questions or encounter any issues.
articles.title: Improvements of our Invoicing app

articles.author: Yannick, Customer Care Team Leader - Pro Team
articles.description:
Improvement
¬†¬†
We would like to inform you that we will deploy a nice improvement to your websites.
Starting today, all Smily websites will be under SSL certificates.
There is nothing you have to do on your side, this change will be automatic and shall not impact your website‚Äôs accessibility.
What does it mean ?
Your website‚Äôs URL will be starting with https:// and no longer http://.
What are the benefits of this change ?
Websites are more secured
Better user experience
Users stay longer and buy more on secured websites
Sites with HTTPS load faster
HTTPS leads to accurate SEO reporting
Better SEO : SSL is a positive ranking factor for Google. Google‚Äôs team has expressed the need for HTTPS time and time again. So much so that they‚Äôve released an algorithm update based on it‚Äîcausing sites without HTTPS security to struggle on their quest to rank highly in the search engines results.
Feel free to reach out to us if you have any question !
articles.title: Websites security improvement

articles.author: Ella, Head of Customer Care and OnBoarding team
articles.description:
Communications
¬†¬†
As the temperature rises and your guests start packing, the Smily team wanted to take a moment to wish you a wonderful summer season. Our dedicated team is here to support you at every step during the 2023 summer season! üéâ
At Smily, we value your partnership and understand the challenges that come with managing vacation rentals. As we enter this busy period together, we would like to share some last-minute tips that can help ensure a successful season for all.
Embrace multidiffusion:
As many of you may have noticed, the number of reservations received from Airbnb has been on the decline recently. This trend has been noticed by many in the industry. To counter this we highly recommend taking advantage of our integrations with Holidu, Maeva, Locasun/Leboncoin, Cdiscount, a‚Ä¶
articles.title: Smily Summer Success Strategies: Tips and Insights for a memorable Season! ‚òÄÔ∏è

articles.description:
Jul 28, 11:28 PDT
Resolved - [False alarm] This incident was a false alarm‚Äîthe LOS Records API is working as expected. Apologies for the inconvenience.
Jul 28, 10:02 PDT
Identified - Starting today (July 28, 2023), we identified an issue affecting the LOS Records API. Records for 180 days from today (beyond Jan 24, 2024) are being ignored, and the dates are marked as unavailable on Airbnb, although requests to set those records are not failing. We are actively working to find the root cause, and mitigate this issue. We will post more information as soon as possible.
articles.title: Incident Affecting LOS Records API

articles.description:
Jul 13, 09:22 PDT
Resolved - We have backfilled message threads for the reservations that were affected during this time window. You should now be able to retrieve the `thread_id` associated with a reservation using the Reservations API. Apologies for the inconvenience.
If you have any further queries related to this incident, please submit a ticket via the Partner Support Portal and our team will get back to you as soon as possible.
Jul 12, 12:25 PDT
Identified - We have identified an issue that caused reservations to be created without associated threads. This occurred between 10:15 PM and 11:29 PM on July 12th (PST), so notifications for reservations created during that time were sent with a null `thread_id` value.
We are actively working on creating threads for reservations that do not have them, and will update here afterwards.
Once this is done, you will be able to retrieve the `thread_id` value for a reservation using the Reservations API.
articles.title: Reservations Missing Thread Id Values

Jul 27, 03:20 UTC
Completed - The scheduled maintenance has been completed.
Jul 27, 01:02 UTC
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.
Jul 26, 23:08 UTC
Scheduled - Start: 2023-07-27 01:00 UTC
End: 2023-07-27 05:00 UTC

During the above window, our Networking team will be making changes to our core networking infrastructure to improve performance and scalability in the SFO3 region. This will be the second of the two maintenance activities performed by our team in the region on consecutive days.
Expected Impact:
These upgrades are designed and tested to be seamless and we do not expect any impact to customer traffic due to this maintenance. If an unexpected issue arises, affected Droplets and Droplet-based services may experience a temporary loss of private connectivity between VPCs. We will endeavour to keep any such impact to a minimum.
If you have any questions or concerns regarding this maintenance, please reach out to us by opening up a ticket on your account via https://cloudsupport.digitalocean.com/s/createticket.
articles.title: SFO3 Network Maintenance Phase 2

These upgrades are designed and tested to be seamless and we do not expect any impact to customer traffic due to this maintenance. Resolved - From 14:53 - 15:26 UTC, we experienced an issue with Kubernetes clusters and our Kubernetes API. During that time, users would have experienced errors while communicating with their clusters , as well as seen errors while sending requests to API endpoints. Errors to the API manifested as 404's on /v2/kubernetes/clusters endpoints. 
Our Engineering team was able to take swift action to roll back a breaking change, remediating the incident. 
We apologize for the disruption in service. If you are still experiencing any problems or have additional questions, then please open a support ticket within your account.
articles.title: Kubernetes Clusters

articles.description:
Incident began at 2023-07-24 14:50 and ended at 2023-07-26 11:15 (times are in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC)).

Incident Report

Summary

On 24 July 2023 at 07:50, following a Google Classroom iOS app update, the app would not load properly if users attempted to access any course page that had attached materials for a duration of 1 day, 20 hours, 25 minutes. During the disruption, users were able to access course pages by uninstalling and reinstalling the Classroom iOS app.

Root Cause

The root cause has been identified as a bug, triggered by an update released for Classroom iOS, that caused an issue with the local database migration. This caused the iOS app to not load properly when users attempted to access course pages with attached materials, as the migration was specific to the materials configuration.

Remediation and Prevention

Google engineers were alerted to the issue via internal monitoring on 24 July 2023 at 07:50 US/Pacific and immediately started an investigation. Google engineers reproduced the issue, identified the trigger as a failed database migration, and paused the auto update. This prevented any further disruption. An app update with a fix was released for the Classroom iOS app, thereby resolving the issue on 26 July 2023 at 04:15 US/Pacific. Users who had already updated to the problematic app version were advised to either uninstall and reinstall or update the app to the version with the fix.

Google is committed to preventing recurrence by implementing the following action items:

  • Implement additional pre-release migration and application testing plans to validate app stability

Affected products: Classroom
articles.title: RESOLVED: We're investigating reports of an issue with Classroom. We will provide more information shortly.

articles.title: Incident with Codespaces

articles.description:
Issue Summary:


On August 7, 2023, customers may have experienced issues with loading images, creating canvases, and workflow modals being delayed. A small number of customers may have been impacted as early as 5:50 AM PDT, with larger impact seen between 7:03AM PDT to 7:14AM PDT.


We traced the issue to a change that caused our server infrastructure to be overloaded. We rolled back this change, resolving the issue for all impacted users.
articles.title: Incident: Users may be experiencing issues uploading images and creating canvases.

articles.description: We‚Äôve restored full functionality to file uploads for all impacted users. You may need to reload Slack (Command/Ctrl + Shift + R) in order for this fix to be reflected on your end. We‚Äôre sorry for the disruption we brought to your day.
articles.title: Incident: Some users may be experiencing issues uploading files.

articles.description:
Issue summary:

On August 2, 2023 from 9:01 AM PDT to 11:00 AM PDT, customers may have experienced issues with blurry images in Slack, as well as trouble uploading files. A small percentage of customers may have also experienced errors or slowness when loading channels, sending messages, accessing admin pages, and connecting to Slack.


An issue with a routine database cluster migration inadvertently caused a decrease in capacity. Unfortunately, this coincided with a scheduled job to process a large number of custom status requests, an activity that commonly occurs at the top of each hour. The number of incoming requests exceeded the unintentionally reduced capacity of the database cluster, leading to errors and sluggishness for some actions in Slack. As these requests piled up, other Slack services began to experience issues as well, including a small number of users being unable to connect.


We paused the scheduled custom status job to immediately mitigate the load on the affected database cluster. This resolved some of the errors affecting Slack services. Once we established we had sufficient capacity to handle the scheduled job, we resumed processing the custom status requests, fully restoring normal service for all affected users.


Once the load was balanced and custom status processing had returned to normal, we deployed a fix to correct the issue with the database cluster migration, bringing capacity back to the expected level.
articles.title: Incident: Users may be experiencing issues connecting to Slack

articles.description:
Issue Summary:


From July 26th, 2023 at 8:00AM PDT to July 28th 2023 at 1:00PM PDT some users had trouble loading and editing canvases when accessing them from the channel canvas icon.


We determined this issue was caused by a recent code change related to how canvases persist across sessions. We issued a code update which resolved the issue for all impacted users. To see the fix applied, user impacted users should press Command/Control + R. We are also working on deploying a subsequent code update intended to prevent the issue from reoccurring in the future.
articles.title: Incident: Channel canvases not loading correctly.

articles.description:
Issue summary: 


On July 27, 2023 between 2:03 AM PDT - 2:59 AM PDT, Slack was experiencing a systemwide issue during which users were not able to send or receive messages across multiple platforms. 


Our engineering team identified an issue after a change was made to a service that manages our internal system communication. This resulted in degradation of Slack functionality until the change was reverted which resolved the issue for all users. 


We are currently hard at work on scoping measures to prevent this from happening in the future. More information about remediation and prevention steps will be included in an upcoming RCA which you can request by writing into feedback@slack.com.
articles.title: Outage: Slack Systemwide Issues

articles.description:
Issue summary:

On July 25th, 2023 from 3:00 PM PDT to 6:00 PM PDT we received reports of existing members unable to invite new members to workspaces. We traced the cause of issue to a recent code change which prevented emails from being sent. This also impacted logins, workspace creation and potentially other email-based processes. We‚Äôve reverted this change, and the issue was resolved for all customers.
articles.title: Incident: Email service is failing across Slack

articles.description:
Issue Summary:

From 2:46 PM PDT to 6:44 PM PDT on July 21, 2023, some users were unable to unarchive channels to which they belonged.

We determined that a recent code change caused this issue. We reverted the code change and the issue was resolved.
articles.title: Incident: Option to unarchive private channels is missing

articles.description: Users should no longer be experiencing any trouble searching threads. Apologies for the trouble today and thank you for your patience.
articles.title: Incident: Thread search results may be returning as blank for users.

articles.description: Users should no longer be experiencing any trouble loading threads or sending messages. Apologies for the trouble today and thank you for your patience.
articles.title: Incident: Users may be experiencing issues loading threads and sending messages.

articles.description: We‚Äôve identified the cause of this issue. Any users encountering a REB9FC2A4F43 error can reload Slack (Command/Ctrl + Shift + R) in order to resolve this error. Thank you for your patience while we sorted out this issue.
articles.title: Incident: Some user unable to load profiles

articles.description:
Issue Summary:

On July 13, 2023 between 12:19 PM PDT and 12:36 PM PDT, some users encountered errors which led to being unable to load threads, send DMs, joining channels, and accessing Slack overall.


This issue was a result of a failed host in our database infrastructure. We quickly replaced this host, fixing the problem for all impacted users.


Users should no longer be experiencing any trouble accessing Slack.
articles.title: Incident: Trouble with loading threads and accessing Slack

articles.description:
Issue summary:

On July 10, 2023 from 7:08 PM PDT to 7:58 PM PDT, some customers may have experienced various errors while using Slack.


A code change inadvertently added extra load to our server infrastructure. We increased our server capacity to handle this extra load and error rates returned to normal.
articles.title: Incident: Trouble connecting to Slack and performing some actions

Please note that this reactivation will not be visible in the scenario logs.
Currently the platfrom is fully operational but we will continue to monitor situation for the next couple of hours.

We'll post the next update once the fix is rolled out.

We are currently working on reactivating the affected scenarios.
